meanings.definition: Relating to or resulting from experience.
meanings.sent1: The experiential learning program helped students gain practical skills.
meanings.sent2: The workshop offered an experiential approach to understanding complex concepts.
meanings.sent3: The experiential nature of the science experiment made it both educational and fun.
meanings.sent4: Her experiential knowledge of different cultures enriched her storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The experiential journey through the museum left a lasting impression on visitors.

meanings.sent1: The experiential evidence supported his theory.
meanings.sent2: The company values experiential knowledge over theoretical expertise.
meanings.sent3: His experiential approach to problem-solving always yielded innovative solutions.
meanings.sent4: The experiential aspect of travel broadens one's perspective on the world.
meanings.sent5: Experiential learning allows students to apply theory to real-life situations.

meanings.sent1: The experiential therapy session helped her confront her fears.
meanings.sent2: The experiential workshop encouraged participants to step out of their comfort zones.
meanings.sent3: His experiential journey into entrepreneurship taught him valuable lessons.
meanings.sent4: The experiential nature of the retreat allowed for deep self-reflection.
meanings.sent5: Experiential activities like hiking can be both physically and mentally rewarding.
